_comment: Configuration for multi-feature synthesis with multiprocessing enabled

_description.population_size: Size of the GA population for each feature evolution (default: 100)
_description.max_generations: Maximum number of generations to evolve for each feature (default: 50)
_description.elitism: Whether to use elitism (keep best individual) (default: true)
_description.use_multi_feature: Set to true to evolve multiple features sequentially
_description.n_features_to_create: Number of features to create sequentially (each adds to the dataset)
_description.cv: Number of cross-validation folds for fitness evaluation (default: 3)
_description.use_multiprocessing: Enable multiprocessing for fitness calculations (recommended for larger populations)
_description.n_jobs: Number of processes to use for multiprocessing (4 is good for most systems, -1 uses all cores)

_performance_notes.multiprocessing_benefit: Multiprocessing provides significant speedup for populations > 20
_performance_notes.recommended_n_jobs: Use 2-8 processes depending on your CPU cores and memory
_performance_notes.memory_usage: Each process will load the dataset and model, consider memory limits
_performance_notes.optimal_settings: For multi-feature synthesis, reduce population_size and max_generations per feature since multiple features are evolved
